Authors: Zahedi Z., Salim A., Yusriski R., Haris H.
Title: Optimization of an integrated batch production and maintenance scheduling on flow shop with two machines
Source title: International Journal of Industrial Engineering Computations
Affiliations: Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia; Trisakti School of Transportation Management, IPN Kebon Nanas Street, Jakarta, 13410, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Zahedi, Z., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salim, A., Department of Mathematics, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Syahdan Street 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yusriski, R., Department of Industrial Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Jendral Ahmad Yani University (UNJANI), Gatot Subroto Street, Bandung, 40285, Indonesia; Haris, H., Trisakti School of Transportation Management, IPN Kebon Nanas Street, Jakarta, 13410, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper discusses an integrated model of batch production and maintenance scheduling on flow shop with two deteriorating machines producing single item to be delivered at a due date. The model describes the trade-off between production and maintenance costs as the production run length increases on two machines. The objective function of the model is to minimize the total cost consisting of in process and completed part inventory costs, setup costs, preventive & corrective maintenance costs and rework costs on two machines. The step-wise optimization algorithm is developed to solve a mixed integer quadratic programming. Comparison with the practice and the model sensitivity analysis are demonstrated to clarify how the algorithm works. © 2019 by the authors; licensee Growing Science, Canada.
Author Keywords: Batch production; Flow shop; Machine maintenance; Two machines

Title: Average-based fuzzy time series markov chain in JCI forecasting
Source title: Far East Journal of Mathematical Sciences
Affiliations: Mathematics and Statistics Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rachmawati, R.N., Mathematics and Statistics Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Johari, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Salim, A., Mathematics and Statistics Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: We employ average-based concept to calculate the value of an average interval of historical data, fuzziness to classify variables, time series to observe a certain period of data and Markov model in prediction process using transition probability. The analysis is applied to predict the currency exchange rates (USD-IDR). © 2016 Pushpa Publishing House, Allahabad, India.
Author Keywords: Fuzzy time series model; Markov chain

Authors: Rachmawati R.N., Gamalita A., Suhartono D., Salim A.
Title: FTMC web application for JCI prediction
Source title: Far East Journal of Mathematical Sciences
Affiliations: Mathematics and Statistics Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rachmawati, R.N., Mathematics and Statistics Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Gamalita, A., Mathematics and Statistics Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suhartono, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Salim, A., Mathematics and Statistics Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: In this paper, the analysis predictions of Jakarta composite index (JCI) closing price using fuzzy time series Markov chain model are discussed. This method includes three main concepts, the concepts of fuzzy, time series and Markov chain. Fuzzy concepts are useful to classify variables, time series concept to observe the JCI movement during a particular period and Markov chain concept is used in process prediction of JCI values using the transition probability matrix. To assist the analysis of predictions, we design a web-based application that aims to predict by analyzing a JCI data set closing price on a certain period, so that the process can be more efficient, thorough and practical. We compare the accuracy of FTMC and prediction powered from Song and Chissom. The resulting value is quite accurate and can assist users in making decisions relating to the exercise of economic activity. © 2015 Pushpa Publishing House, Allahabad, India.
Author Keywords: Fuzzy time series model; JCI; Markov chain; Web
References: Arumugam, P., Anithakumari, V., Fuzzy time series method for forecasting Taiwan export data (2013) Inter. J. Engin. Trends Tech.
